verb.description: (of an appearance) fail to give a true notion or impression of (something); disguise or contradict.
examples: his lively, alert manner belied his years

verb.description: Fail to fulfill or justify (a claim or expectation); betray.
examples: the notebooks belie Darwin's later recollection

origin: Old English belēogan deceive by lying, from be- about + lēogan to lie. Current senses date from the 17th century.
